metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23455 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
atm_tc_enqueue in net/sched/sch_atm.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.4 allows attackers to cause a denial of service because of type confusion (non-negative numbers can sometimes indicate a TC_ACT_SHOT condition rather than valid classification results). Kyle Zeng discovered that the ATM VC queuing discipline implementation in the Linux kernel contained a type confusion vulnerability in some situations. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1117-aws - 4.4.0-1117.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> the break entry, b0188d4dbe5f ("[NET_SCHED]: sch_atm: Lindent"), is likely incorrect, as it is just code format changes. rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, it got fixed in version 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1 as published in USN-6009-1.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.123').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1').
